instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont see the battery
threads.message:
I tried 2 batteries and same story, this board came in not turning on, replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR>, now it turns on but I wont see the battery even with 2 different ones and SMC reset.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> Pin 10 has odd 0.037, Pin 12 0.171, Pin 17 0.602 all others measure fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont see the battery
threads.message: Did you tight the special screw?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont see the battery
threads.message: Agreed and if so what voltage on PPBUS charger only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont see the battery
threads.message: [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] Yes all good there, in fact I have another one of those boards here that I tested on that same MacBook and works as expected, I will check PPBUS charger only and post info soon.
